verb.description: Stitch down (the edge of a seam) to lie flat.

adjective.description: Of terrible evil or ferocity; deadly.
examples: sorcerers use spells to achieve their fell ends

origin: Old English fel, fell, of Germanic origin; related to Dutch vel and German Fell, from an Indo-European root shared by Latin pellis and Greek pella skin.
phrases: nothing can topple the government in one fell swoop
In one fell swoop, professional regulation has been radically and disturbingly transformed.
In one fell swoop, it gets new customers for its existing products and new products for its existing customers.
In one fell swoop they are increasing the amount of traffic on the roads.
Freedom and privacy rarely, if ever, disappear in one fell swoop.
